642.title: You grant perpetual license to anything you publish

tosdr.case: You grant perpetual license to anything you publish-bad-80
tosdr.tldr: You grant perpetual license to use anything you publish. While the global license expires when you unsubscribe, public content will remain licensed and will not be deleted.

meta.author: Ian McGowan

689.quoteText:
Spotify shares your personal data globally with other companies in the Spotify Group in order to carry out the activities specified in this Policy. This includes to Spotify Group companies in the following countries: Australia, Austria, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Italy, Japan, Luxembourg, Mexico, The Netherlands, Poland, Singapore, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Taiwan, Turkey, United Kingdom and the United States of America. Spotify may also subcontract processing to, or share your personal data with, third parties located in countries other than your home country. Your personal data, therefore, may be subject to privacy laws that are different from those in your country of residence.

Personal data collected within the European Union and Switzerland may, for example, be transferred to and processed by third parties located in a country outside of the European Union and Switzerland. In such instances Spotify shall ensure that the transfer of your personal data is carried out in accordance with applicable privacy laws and, in particular, that appropriate contractual, technical, and organisational measures are in place such as the Standard Contractual Clauses approved by the EU Commission.
689.title: Your data may be processed and stored anywhere in the world

tosdr.case: Your data may be processed and stored anywhere in the world
tosdr.tldr: Spotify may transfer and process your data outside of your home country. This includes potentially a country in which you have fewer legal rights regarding your personal information.

meta.author: Ian McGowan
meta.license-for-this-file: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ or send a letter to Creative Commons, 444 Castro Street, Suite 900, Mountain View, California, 94041, .USA

713.quoteText:
This personal data is used to enable Spotify and our partners / service providers to send you marketing communications either:
  • Via email.
  • Whilst using the Spotify Service. and/or
  • Direct from the third party.
713.title: Your data is accessible to trading partners

tosdr.case: Your personal data is given to third parties
tosdr.tldr: Your data is accessible to any of Spotify's trading partners. In addition, such data isn't expressly defined in the EULA.

meta.author: Ian McGowan
meta.license-for-this-file: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ or send a letter to Creative Commons, 444 Castro Street, Suite 900, Mountain View, California, 94041, .USA

719.quoteText:
Remember that shared or publicly available information may be used and re-shared by other users on Spotify or across the web, so please use Spotify carefully and be mindful of your account settings.
Spotify has no responsibility for your choices to post material on the Service.
719.title: Spotify states risks of public information

tosdr.case: The service informs users about the risk of publishing personal info online
tosdr.tldr: Spotify expressly states the implications of keeping information public, and also that certain specific information (e.g., username, profile picture) may not be able to be made private.

meta.author: Ian McGowan
meta.license-for-this-file: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ or send a letter to Creative Commons, 444 Castro Street, Suite 900, Mountain View, California, 94041, .USA

741.quoteText:
We implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to help protect the security of your personal data.
however, please note that no system is ever completely secure.
741.title: The service provider makes no warranty regarding uninterrupted, timely, secure or error-free service

tosdr.case: The service provider makes no warranty regarding uninterrupted, timely, secure or error-free service
tosdr.tldr: Although Spotify states they are committed to data security, the also state that they cannot guarantee any success in that area.

meta.author: Ian McGowan

To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ or send a letter to Creative Commons, 444 Castro Street, Suite 900, Mountain View, California, 94041, .USA

755.quoteText:
Unless your Paid Subscription has been purchased as a Pre-Paid Period, your payment to Spotify will automatically renew at the end of the subscription period, unless you cancel your Paid Subscription through your subscription page before the end of the current subscription period.
The cancellation will take effect the day after the last day of the current subscription period, and you will be downgraded to the Free Service.
755.title: You can unsubscribe at any time

tosdr.case: You have the right to leave this service at any time
tosdr.tldr: Spotify provides a link in order to cancel your subscription to their services, which you can do at any time. However, the cancellation takes effect after the last day of the current subscription period, so if you cancel before the end of the subscription period, Spotify will not offer you a refund.

meta.author: Ian McGowan

771.quoteText:
We may occasionally make changes to this Policy.

When we make material changes to this Policy, we’ll provide you with prominent notice as appropriate under the circumstances, e.g., by displaying a prominent notice within the Spotify Service or by sending you an email. We may notify you in advance.

Please, therefore, make sure you read any such notice carefully.
771.title: Users should revisit the terms periodically, although in case of material changes, the service will notify

tosdr.case: Users should revisit the terms periodically, although in case of material changes, the service will notify

To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ or send a letter to Creative Commons, 444 Castro Street, Suite 900, Mountain View, California, 94041, .USA

817.quoteText:
We have set out in the tables below the categories of personal data we collect and use about you:

Personal data collected when you sign up for the Spotify Service

Categories of personal data Description of category Account Registration Data This is the personal data that is provided by you or collected by us to enable you to sign up for and use the Spotify Service. This includes your email address, birth date, gender, postal code, and country.

Some of the personal data we will ask you to provide is required in order to create your account. You also have the option to provide us with some additional personal data in order to make your account more personalized.

The exact personal data we will collect depends on the type of Spotify Service plan you sign up for and whether or not you use a Third Party Service (as defined in the Terms and Conditions of Use, such as Facebook) to sign up and use the Spotify Service. If you use a Third Party Service to create an account, we will receive personal data via that Third Party Service but only when you have consented to that Third Party Service sharing your personal data with us.

Personal data collected through your use of the Spotify Service

Categories of personal data Description of category Spotify Service Usage Data This is the personal data that is collected about you when you are using the Spotify Service - this may include:
  • Information about your type of Spotify Service plan.
  • Information about your interactions with the Spotify Service which includes the date and time of any requests you make, songs you have listened to, playlists you create, video content you’ve watched, and your interactions with other Spotify users. This also may include details of your use of Third Party Applications and advertising you receive.
  • User Content (as defined in the Terms and Conditions of Use) you post to Spotify including messages you send and/or receive via Spotify and your interactions with the Spotify Customer Service team.
817.title: Personal data is defined

tosdr.case: The service provides details about what kinds of personal information they collect
tosdr.tldr: Personal data is described in PP §2. However, If you connect to Spotify using Facebook, they will have access to more data.

852.quoteText: Spotify may terminate the Agreements or suspend your access to the Spotify Service at any time, including in the event of your actual or suspected unauthorised use of the Spotify Service and/or Content, or non-compliance with the Agreements.
852.title: Spotify can delete your account without telling you

tosdr.case: The service can delete your account without prior notice and without a reason
tosdr.tldr: Spotify can close your account without notice, without refund, for any or no reason.

To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ or send a letter to Creative Commons, 444 Castro Street, Suite 900, Mountain View, California, 94041, .USA

854.quoteText:
We may collect such personal data if you sign up for a Trial or purchase any of our Paid Subscriptions (as defined in the Terms and Conditions of Use) or make other purchases through the Spotify Service. The exact personal data collected will vary depending on the payment method (e.g. direct via your mobile phone carrier or by invoice) but will include information such as:
  • Name.
  • Date of birth;
  • Credit or debit card type, expiration date, and certain digits of your card number;
  • Postal code;
  • Mobile phone number. and
  • Details of your transaction history.
If you choose to pay by invoice, we will provide your personal data to our payment processors to enable them to complete a credit check and to send you invoices.
854.title: The service provides information about how they collect personal data

tosdr.case: The service provides information about how they collect personal data
tosdr.tldr: Spotify uses a third party to process payments, although they do not specify who. However, the privacy policy does specify the limited information that is provided to Spotify from this third party (e.g., card type, expiration date, last four digits).

To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ or send a letter to Creative Commons, 444 Castro Street, Suite 900, Mountain View, California, 94041, .USA

855.quoteText: We will share your personal data when we in good faith believe it is necessary for us to do so in order to comply with a legal obligation under applicable law, or respond to valid legal process, such as a search warrant, a court order, or a subpoena.
855.title: No promise to inform about government requests

tosdr.case: This service reserves the right to disclose your personal information without notifying you
tosdr.tldr: Spotify does not explicitly state that they will inform users of any law or government requests regarding any personal user information.

877.quoteText: Contests, Surveys and Sweepstakes Data This personal data is used to allow you to sign up and participate in these types of promotions. The exact personal data collected will vary depending on the promotion.
877.title: Spotify may merge your current personal info with more if you participate in a Special Promotion

tosdr.case: The service may collect extra data about you through promotions
tosdr.tldr: If you participate in a Special Promotion (sweepstakes, contests, surveys), Spotify may ask for certain personal information in addition to what they already have. They may then combine that information with your current file.

905.quoteText:
IF YOU DO NOT WANT TO CONTINUE TO BE CHARGED ON A RECURRING MONTHLY BASIS, YOU MUST CANCEL THE APPLICABLE PAID SUBSCRIPTION THROUGH YOUR SPOTIFY ACCOUNT’S SUBSCRIPTION PAGE OR TERMINATE YOUR SPOTIFY ACCOUNT BEFORE THE END OF THE RECURRING MONTHLY PERIOD.
PAID SUBSCRIPTIONS CANNOT BE TERMINATED BEFORE THE END OF THE PERIOD FOR WHICH YOU HAVE ALREADY PAID, AND EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY PROVIDED IN THESE TERMS, SPOTIFY WILL NOT REFUND ANY FEES THAT YOU HAVE ALREADY PAID.
THE LIMITATION SECTION SETS FORTH ADDITIONAL TERMS REGARDING CANCELLATION OF YOUR PAID SUBSCRIPTION.
905.title: Spotify doesn't provide refunds

tosdr.case: The service has a no refund policy
tosdr.tldr: Spotify does not offer refunds upon termination of their services, either by you or Spotify.

meta.author: Ian McGowan
meta.license-for-this-file: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ or send a letter to Creative Commons, 444 Castro Street, Suite 900, Mountain View, California, 94041, .USA

926.quoteText: To provide, personalize, and improve your experience with the Spotify Service and other services and products provided by Spotify, for example by providing customized, personalized, or localized content, recommendations, features, and advertising on or outside of the Spotify Service (including for third party products and services).
926.title: Spotify defines intended use of your information

tosdr.case: The service provides information about how they intend to use your personal data
tosdr.tldr: Spotify may use the information they collect to provide, personalize, and improve your experience; provide customized or localized content and advertising; make sure the Service and products are functioning properly; analyze your use of the Service; communication with you (including promotional emails or messages); promote the Service; and finally, to enforce their Privacy Policy.

1012.quoteText:
TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, SPOTIFY AND ALL OWNERS OF THE CONTENT MAKE NO REPRESENTATIONS AND DISCLAIM ANY WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF SATISFACTORY QUALITY, MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT.
NEITHER SPOTIFY NOR ANY OWNER OF CONTENT WARRANTS THAT THE SPOTIFY SERVICE IS FREE OF MALWARE OR OTHER HARMFUL COMPONENTS.
1012.title: Spotify gives no guarantee for quality of service

tosdr.case: This services gives no guarantee regarding quality
tosdr.tldr: There is no guarantee of quality of service. If the service is not delivered to your expectations, you still pay for it to the extent of applicable law.

1082.title: The ToS are only translated into a few languages

tosdr.case: The terms for this service are translated into different languages
tosdr.tldr: Although Spotify allows users to choose their country (Andorra, Australia, Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Ireland, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Monaco, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom, United States), the terms themselves are only available in English, French, German, and Spanish.

1092.quoteText: TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, YOUR SOLE AND EXCLUSIVE REMEDY FOR ANY PROBLEMS OR DISSATISFACTION WITH THE SPOTIFY SERVICE IS TO UNINSTALL ANY SPOTIFY SOFTWARE AND TO STOP USING THE SPOTIFY SERVICE.
1092.title: Spotify provides limited solutions for software problems

tosdr.case: This services gives no guarantee regarding quality
tosdr.tldr: Uninstalling the software is the only possible action for users if they have any problems.

1143.quoteText:
Technical Data which may include URL information, cookie data, your IP address, the types of devices you are using to access or connect to the Spotify Service, unique device IDs, device attributes, network connection type (e.g.
WiFi, 3G, LTE, Bluetooth) and provider, network and device performance, browser type, language, information enabling digital rights management, operating system, and Spotify application version.
1143.title: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.

tosdr.case: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.
tosdr.tldr:
"All the information we collect is related to providing the Spotify service and its features."

and

"Technical and sensor information necessary to operate Spotify. This includes the type of browser and device you use, data from the touchscreen, and information from your device’s accelerometer and gyroscope sensors. This enables you to control Spotify and allows us to do simple things like rotate videos and recommend music based on whether you’re sitting still or running." (so no device fingerprinting for the purpose of advertising, like a lot of other services do).
